page.title: 05BURNHAM OVERY - FISHING
page.content: Fishing as a professional activity at Burnham Overy Staithe is now reduced to the cultivation of {Mussels}grown on from stock brought in from the Wash. There is a certain amount of lug worm digging, and a few boats go out to the sea for crabs. Fishing as a more occasional or recreational activity includes trawling for mackerel, as well as the use of nets laid along the beach, where there is evidence of an increase of fish in comparison with the lower quantity of the last few years. The cockle strand which unfortunately no longer contains cockles gave the name {Cockle Path} to the route across the marshes from Overy to the harbour sands. This path recently renovated by the Harbour Trust with the aid of the M.S.C is used by many holiday makers each year.
